newsitem.title: USA: Artisoft cuts LANtastic jobs, sees charge.
newsitem.headline: Artisoft cuts LANtastic jobs, sees charge.

text.p: Artisoft Inc, a maker of computer networking and communications equipment, said on Thursday that it is cutting 50 employees from its LANtastic network division, or about 15 percent of its workforce.
In addition, the company will take charges against its earnings in the September quarter to account for severance and related expenses for the cuts.
LANtastic is the name of the network operating system Artisoft makes. In a statement, the company said expenses for LANtastic are "not commensurate" with its growth rate and future prospects.
Artisoft did not say how much the charge would be or what effect it would have on the September quarter, its first quarter of fiscal 1997.
In a statement, the company said it would re-direct the funds toward research and development of its communications and telphone software business with an eye to new products.
"Our objective is to accelerate the development, delivery and customer adoption of the strategic communications products we expect to soon be announcing," said William Keiper.
